byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and WILLIAM J. BROAD

abstract: News Analysis; Iranian engineers begin daunting task to quickly dismantle country’s nuclear military program, spurred by agreement’s promise to remove $100 billion in sanctions once process is completed; both sides worry over compliance of huge and complex disassemblement, concerned it may be done so hastily components could be overlooked, which would lead to re-institution of sanctions.
lead_paragraph: As the deal takes effect, Iran insists it can quickly complete a complex nuclear dismantlement, but Iran and the United States each fear the possibility of cheating and disagreement.

headline.main: Now the Hardest Part: Making the Iran Deal Work
headline.print_headline: Now the Hardest Part: Making the Iran Deal Work

snippet: As the deal takes effect, Iran insists it can quickly complete a complex nuclear dismantlement, but Iran and the United States each fear the possibility of cheating and disagreement.
